name: wainscoting
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an area of flat, rectangular pieces of wood or another material that are attached to the lower parts of the walls in a room, or the wood, etc. that is used in this way: Varnished wainscoting covered the lower half of the dining and living room walls. She led them through the opening in the wainscoting down a narrow secret corridor. The house had much of its original material, including wainscotting, pine stairs, and oak floors.
ucpage/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe remodelled secondary school has fir wainscoting salvaged from the walls of the original school.The decorative brickwork, arched openings, wainscotting and other wood trim are important architectural features of the building, put up in 1908.Dark wainscoting lines the walls, and the ceilings are fitted with ornate crown moldings.The wainscoting was of Hauteville marble.
